list_definition.definition: (a person) more interested in what happens around him than his own ideas and feelings

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: An extrovert (person) is usually good company.

list_ex_of_english: Indeed, he probably needs to be a little more extrovert.
After all, social interaction is at once the defining characteristic of the extrovert and an essential feature of many participatory political acts.
There is an overarching direction to the work which moves more and more into an inner spiritual world from its more concrete and extrovert beginning.
For instance, the political effects of extroversion may differ for extroverts who are high rather than low in conscientiousness.
Interestingly, extroverts have relatively high levels of political discussion and opinionation, but relatively low levels of political knowledge.
Thirdly, the optimistic 'can-do' quality of the extrovert previously has been linked to self-efficacy,48 and thus we expect extroverts to express high levels of internal political efficacy.
Márquez has an assured, extrovert voice, and reports folk forms in his blood since he learned the mariachi violin in childhood.
The musical fabric is abstract but curiously involving, from the whispered opening to the more extrovert closing section.
